brief_title: Study of Pituitary Size and Function in Familial Dwarfism of Sindh
brief_summary: OBJECTIVES: I. Assess pituitary size and anatomic configuration by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) in 4 affected dwarfs in the province of Sindh, Pakistan. II. Evaluate ultradian growth hormone (GH) secretory patterns in 4 affected dwarfs.
detailed_description: PROTOCOL OUTLINE: Pituitary size and anatomy and growth hormone response are evaluated. All patients undergo MRI of the pituitary fossa on day 1. On day 2, homozygous patients receive a slow infusion of normal saline with blood sampling every 10 minutes.
criteria: - Familial Dwarfism of Sindh - Severe short stature but proportionate without dysmorphic features - Normal body size and weight at birth - Bone age is severely delayed - Puberty is somewhat delayed (age 15-16) - Fertility present in at least 3 dwarfs
